column3: Go to the admin Applications search at /admin/applications
Select an application that is not in the "Accepted" or "Rejected" state, and click "Review application"

column4: The managing editor view application form is displayed
"Unlock and Close" is available
The Quick Reject feature is available
The ability to assign to an editor group and associate editor is available
A "SAVE" button is available
Status, Re-assign publisher account, Continuation Information and Subject Classification sections are available
Award the Seal is available
The main application form questions are available
The Notes section is available
The "Group" pull-down asks you to type three characters.
The associate editors and editor are shown in the Individual dropdown

column3: Select an editor from the "Individual" pull-down

column4: The editor is selected

column3: Unset the Editor Group using the grey "X" in the "Editor Group" pull-down box

column4: The editor group and associate editor are removed

column3: Assign a new editor group and associate editor
Expand the tree and browse for values below the top level

column4: Assign two subject classifications.

column3: Start typing a subject in the subject search box

column4: Assign one subject that way

column3: Assign an owner to the application
Make a superficial modification to the application metadata
Click "Add new note" and enter some text into the new note textarea

column4: A message tells you that you cannot save the application because it contains some invalid fields
The form scrolls you down to a question which has a missing answer.

column3: Complete the question with the missing answer and 'Save'

column4: A message at the top of the form tells you that you can only choose one or two subject classifications
The form saves
The changes you applied, both to the form, and in the functionality box, have been saved
The form saved without requiring answers to the ORCiD and I4OA questions.
The page closes, and you are able to return to the search interface
